programme.title: USA-FRA - Men's Gold Medal Game | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Gold Medal Game took place at Bercy Arena, France, on 10/08/2024. The United States of America won the Gold with a final score: USA 98:87 FRA.

programme.title: Men's 10m Platform Final | Diving | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 10m Platform Final took place at the Aquatics Centre, on 10/08/24. Yuan Cao (CHN) won Gold, Rikuto Tamai (JPN) won Silver and Noah Williams (GBR) completed the podium.

programme.title: Ehlers/Wickler (GER) v Ahman/Hellvig (SWE) - Men's Gold Medal Match | Beach Volleyball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Gold Medal Match between Sweden and Germany took place at the Eiffel Tower - Centre Court on 10/08/24. Sweden won the Gold with a Final Score of 2:0.

programme.title: Personal Best: Paris 2024
programme.desc: Relive the Paris 2024 Olympic Games through the journeys of eight remarkable athletes who pushed past limits, defied expectations, and inspired the world. Featuring Noah Lyles, Faith Kipyegon, Jack Robinson, Huang Yaqiong and Zheng Siwei, Leon Marchand, Olga Kharlan and Cindy Ngamba.

programme.title: Women's -49kg & Men's -58kg Repechages/Finals | Taekwondo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session includes the Women's -49kg & Men's -58kg Repechages/Finals which took place at the Grand Palais on 07/08/24.
The Women's -49Kg was won by Panipak Wongpattanakit (THA) with Gold, Qing Guo (CHN) with Silver and a tie in Bronze by Mobina Nematzadeh (IRI) and Lena Stojkovic (CRO).
The Men's -58kg was won by Taejoon Park (KOR) with Gold, Gashim Magomedov (AZE) with Silver and Bronze for Cyrian Ravet (FRA) and Mohamed Jendoubi (TUN).

programme.title: How Jordan’s Olympic medal turned Ahmad Abughaush into an icon
programme.desc: When Ahmad Abughaush won Jordan’s first-ever Olympic gold medal in 2016, he instantly became an icon for his fellow countrymen.

programme.title: Men's 200m Individual Medley - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 200m Individual Medley was held at Paris La Defense Arena, on 02/08/2024. Leon Marchand (FRA) claimed Gold with a new Olympic Record time 1:54.06, Duncan Scott (GBR) took Silver and Wang Shun (CHN) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's 100m Butterfly - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 100m Butterfly was held at Paris La Defense Arena, on 03/08/2024. Kristof Milak (HUN) claimed Gold with a time of 49.90 seconds, Josh Liendo (CAN) took Silver and Ilya Kharun (CAN) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 200m Individual Medley - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 200m Individual Medley was held at Paris La Defense Arena, on 03/08/2024. Summer McIntosh (CAN) claimed Gold with a new Olympic Record time of 2:06.56, Kate Douglass (USA) took Silver and Kaylee McKeown (AUS) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's 1500m Freestyle - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 1500m Freestyle was held at Paris La Defense Arena, on 04/08/2024. Bobby Finke (USA) claimed Gold with a World Record time of 14:30.67, Gregorio Paltrinieri (ITA) took Silver and Daniel Wiffen (IRL) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's 4x100m Medley Relay - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 4x100m Medley Relay was held at Paris La Defense Arena, on 04/08/2024. The People's Republic of China claimed Gold with a time of 3:27.46min, The United States of America took Silver and France completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 4x100m Medley Relay - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 4x100m Medley Relay was held at Paris La Defense Arena, on 04/08/2024. The United States of America claimed Gold with a World Record time of 3:49.63, Australia took Silver and The People's Republic of China completed the podium.

programme.title: On the Line: Swimming
programme.desc: Discovering other names, stories and anecdotes behind the mythical Olympic Finals of swimming

programme.title: Women's 81kg | Weightlifting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This session includes the Women's 81kg which took place at the South Paris Arena 6, France, on the 10/08/24. Solfrid Eila Amena Koanda (NOR) claimed Gold, Sara Ahmed (EGY) took Silver and Neisi Patricia Dajomes Barrera (ECU) completed the podium.

programme.title: Lyla Nourtier: you can succeed - France / Weighlifting I By Her Rules
programme.desc: Lyla is a 15 year old weightlifter from a small village in France without much access to sports. We meet her at a turning point in her life as she plans to leave home to pursue her dream. She joins an elite sport and education program where she is the first ever female weightlifter.

programme.title: BRA-TUR - Women's Bronze Medal Match | Volleyball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Bronze Medal Match took place at South Paris Arena 1, Paris, on 10/08/2024. Brazil won Bronze with a final score BRA 3:1 TUR.

programme.title: This transgender volleyball player’s path leads to an NCAA women’s team
programme.desc: Follow Chloe Anderson as she heads to UC-Santa Cruz and meets her new team-mates for the first time.

programme.title: How water polo MVP Ashleigh Johnson smashed stereotypes
programme.desc: Not only was Johnson the first ever African American woman to compete for Team USA in water polo, she was crowned tournament MVP in Rio.

programme.title: Meet Croatia’s first family of water polo
programme.desc: Yugoslavia was a dominant force in water polo, and the Bukic family from Croatia has been at the heart of it. The father Perica won three Olympic medals. Now his son Luka is carrying on the family legacy by winning silver at Rio 2016.

programme.title: Women's Pole Vault Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Pole Vault Final took place at the Stade de France, France, on 07/08/24. Nina Kennedy (AUS) won Gold with a height of 4.90m. Katie Moon (USA) claimed Silver, and Alysha Newman (CAN) completed the podium.

programme.title: Strangest Moments | Episode 1
programme.desc: In this episode: a crazy marathon race, the Greg Louganis story, a false start disaster, why everyone loves Derek Redmond, and the forgotten Olympics.

programme.title: Men's 89kg | Weightlifting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Weightlifting Men's 89kg took place at the South Paris Arena 6 on 09/08/24. Karlos May Nasar (BUL) won the Gold medal, Yeison Lopez (COL) won the Silver medal and the Bronze medal was for Antonino Pizzolato (ITA).

programme.title: Women's 49kg | Weightlifting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This session includes the Women's 49kg competition which took place at the South Paris Arena 6 on 07/08/24. Hou Zhihui (CHN) won Gold, Mihaela Valentina Cambei (ROU) won Silver and Surodchana Khambao (THA) won Bronze.

programme.title: Olympic Outposts - Episode 4: A global journey to discover sports passions in the most unlikely places.
programme.desc: From gruelling Ultra marathon in Mexico to Samoa’s weightlifting power-house or surfing on the freezing waters in Canada our hosts discover passion for sports in countries you would never expect.

programme.title: The Vault: Julien Alfred, the shoes of Cuba’s wrestling legend, Mexico 1968’s iconic design
programme.desc: Jeannette and Rob discovers Julien Alfred’s kit in The Vault, recently collected at Paris Olympics. The Saint Lucian sprint sensation has overcome many personal challenges to win the first ever gold medal for the Caribbean Island in the 100m final. Rob discovers the magic of a seemingly ordinary dollar bill, in the equestrian community while we learn about the iconic design of Mexico 1968.

programme.title: The Santiago Lange story (extended version)
programme.desc: After five Olympic Games, the Argentine sailor still hadn’t found gold. And then came cancer. Could he win in Rio?

programme.title: Ehlers/Wickler (GER) v Ahman/Hellvig (SWE) - Men's Gold Medal Match | Beach Volleyball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Gold Medal Match between Sweden and Germany took place at the Eiffel Tower - Centre Court on 10/08/24. Sweden won the Gold with a Final Score of 2:0.

programme.title: Sterre Meijer: The influencer | skate-hers
programme.desc: Sterre Meijer is set to be the next big thing in skateboarding and social media. Among the top 5 most-followed female skaters, she's on track to become a media star.

programme.title: Doubles Trouble: Rohan Bopanna’s Olympic Journey
programme.desc: Join India’s top men’s doubles tennis player, Rohan Bopanna, as he seeks the perfect partner for Paris 2024. Relive his historic victories, heartbreaking defeats, and past Olympic adventures and witness his relentless pursuit of excellence at age 44. Will he bring India a long-awaited tennis medal?

programme.title: Niklas Kaul - medal contender for Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Despite an incredible 2019 season, winning gold at the World Championships and setting a world’s best record, decathlete Niklas Kaul from Germany faced challenges at Tokyo 2020 due to an injury sustained in the high jump event. After focusing on recovery and preparing for future competitions, he reached an impressive 4th place at the European Championships in Roma, which puts him back in a position to medal at Paris 2024.

programme.title: Iris Tió is key to Spain’s next gold in Artistic Swimming | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Iris Tió Casas joined the senior national team at 15, living away from her parents most of the time. Four years later she competed in Tokyo where she was the youngest on the team. For Paris 2024, she will be crucial to the team’s chances, aiming for gold at Paris 2024. Her journey reflects immense dedication, resilience, and a dream realized through hard work. She will compete in the team as well as in the duet event with her partner Alissa Ozhogina.

programme.title: Leonardo Fabbri’s success is rooted in family support | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: From his early athletic beginnings to his emotional 22.34m throw, Leonardo's journey is marked by family support and a dream of Olympic success. Despite setbacks, his determination remains unshaken as he aims for glory at Paris 2024. The Tuscan shot putter won gold at the European Championships, setting a championship record and placing him as a serious contender for the coming games.

programme.title: Helen Glover eyes Paris 2024 for her fourth Olympics | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: After winning back-to-back gold in London 2012 and Rio 2016, Helen Glover made a remarkable come-back in Tokyo 2020, being the first mother to row for Britain. She and partner Polly Swann finished fourth. Helen now has her sights on Paris 2024 where she should be competing in the Women's four event, focusing on adding another Olympic medal to her impressive career for Team GB.

programme.title: Chloe Covell: The Rising Star | skate-hers
programme.desc: The Australian sensation whose meteoric rise in the skateboarding world has made her a formidable competitor and a beloved figure in the street scene. Follow Chloe as she challenges the best, forms lasting friendships, and takes one step closer to her Olympic dream. Chloe's journey is one of passion, dedication, and the relentless pursuit of greatness.

programme.title: Pamela Rosa: The Champion | skate-hers
programme.desc: Pamela Rosa from São Paulo, Brazil, is a former women’s world champion in skateboarding. With two X-Games wins and four other podium finishes, she represented Brazil in skateboarding's Olympic debut. Despite an injury in Tokyo, she reclaimed the world champion title in 2021. As a key member of the Brazilian national team, Pamela continues to be one of the most recognizable and formidable skaters in the world.

programme.title: GRLSWIRL: A Global Skate Sisterhood | skate-hers
programme.desc: Lucy Osinski, a former ballerina, discovered new power on a skateboard and founded GRLSWIRL in 2018. This all-female skate sisterhood, born in Venice Beach, embraces femininity in skating. With chapters around the world, Lucy visits Paris to highlight the vibrant community and inspiring vision of GRLSWIRL.

programme.title: Funa Nakayama: The Groundbreaker | skate-hers
programme.desc: Hailing from Toyama City, Funa Nakayama has quickly risen through the skateboarding ranks. At just 18, she's competed in top contests worldwide, earning accolades, including a bronze medal in the 2020 Tokyo Olympics. Follow Funa's journey of hard work, skill, and dedication as she breaks new ground in skateboarding.

programme.title: ‘We’re the Best Team in New York City’ | We Are King
programme.desc: City soccer is very special in New-York City and MLK sits at the top, with 19 titles in 25 years. The team is off to a new season and gunning for its 20th title. Coach Jake and assistant Kamani welcome the team for their first practice and super-pro prospect Carlos Lainez is back from Spain. TThey will soon play the top Ohio State team. After a rough start, the team is taking shape but it’s a 16 match competition before the play-offs begin.

programme.title: ‘The Guy in the Mirror is Usually the One Stopping You’ | We Are King
programme.desc: Carlos Junior, the team captain and best pro prospect has 13 brothers and sisters, 4 are living with him and his dad in the Bronx. A semi-pro club in Spain offered him a contract but he made the promise to Jake and his MLK family to get them that 20th win. Maynor, also from Honduras, is taking care of his disabled mother. After a shaky start to the season, he comes into his own against Upper West Side rival Beacon.

programme.title: ‘You Not Really about it’ | We Are King
programme.desc: MLK high school has been unstoppable this year. They are about to achieve an undefeated season. But Coach Jake is getting increasingly tense. While some players like Charles are doing great both at school and on the team, others like goalkeeper Raymond are struggling to keep their nerves, putting the whole team at risks. Raymond is trying to live up to the dreams and expectations of his father, a talented goalkeeper himself who never made it pro. Soon the team faces a decisive game which will determine the number one seed in the playoffs.

programme.title: ‘This is What We Live For’ | We Are King
programme.desc: MLK finally enters the playoffs. Three more games separate the team from their goal but their starting goalkeeper is now suspended. Assistant coach Kimani, both the kids’ chief on-field instructor and off-field confidant, manages to keep the team in balance. His patience combined with Jake’s drive are a perfect match. Defender Vakaba, who has come to New York City to fulfil his dream, joins the team and becomes an essential part of its success.

programme.title: ‘The Only Game that Matter is the Last One’ | We Are King
programme.desc: Can we tell a King player from another player just by his look?. A storybook season must end in storybook fashion. But as MLK is leading in semi-final, top player Carlos get a yellow card against their long-time rivals Beacon. Jake's obsession is now turning into superstition as he makes a final call that will soon turn the team fortune. Maynor, who had seemed to struggle in front of the goal since the start of the season, is proving to be a decisive striker.

programme.title: ‘Bacon, Egg and Cheese’ | We Are King
programme.desc: David Reyes Aka D. Dotty is a burly defender but he is juggling soccer and a burgeoning rap career with the need to help his family earn money in a tough Bronx neighbourhood. He often comes late or tired to the pitch. As the team moves up the rankings, Coach Jake is getting nervous and talks about his past troubles with addiction.

programme.title: Tom Daley: 1.6 Seconds | Documentary
programme.desc: This feature documentary dives into the life of the UK’s diving legend. From Beijing 2008 to his gold medal in Tokyo 2020 and final Olympics in Paris 2024, Daley shares his personal journey, the pressures, losses, and triumphs that defined his career. Exclusive footage and candid moments reveal a story of resilience and growth.

programme.title: The Vault: Helen Glover, Paris 2024 Costumes, Olympic Refugee Boxer
programme.desc: British rowing sensation Helen Glover comes to The Vault to donate her kit from Paris 2024 and recounts her incredible come back while being a mum of two. Jeannette unveils the incredible costumes from the Paris 2024 ceremonies. Rob stumbles on one of the most precious and largest items of the collection, a two-men rowing scull from Paris 1924 and discovers the surprising story of the unknown French boy who was the coxswain.

programme.title: The Vault: Rebeca Andrade, rare items from the cancelled Tokyo 1940 Games, Olympic torches & swimwear throughout the years
programme.desc: Rebeca Andrade and Simon Biles leotards back-to-back in The Vault take us to the amazing world of gymnastics at the Olympics. We meet the Brazilian queen of gymnastics in training in San Paolo who shared her emotion in dethroning the American legend in the Floor event at Paris 2024 in her sparkling yellow kit. Rob explores a small but very rare collection of objects from the cancelled 1940 Tokyo Games while Jeannette finds herself in the Olympic torch room.

programme.title: The Vault: Julien Alfred, the shoes of Cuba’s wrestling legend, Mexico 1968’s iconic design
programme.desc: Jeannette and Rob discovers Julien Alfred’s kit in The Vault, recently collected at Paris Olympics. The Saint Lucian sprint sensation has overcome many personal challenges to win the first ever gold medal for the Caribbean Island in the 100m final. Rob discovers the magic of a seemingly ordinary dollar bill, in the equestrian community while we learn about the iconic design of Mexico 1968.

programme.title: The Vault: Matthias Steiner, Olympic timekeeping, Sky Brown, Dream Team
programme.desc: Weightlifting legend Matthias Steiner comes to The Vault to share his incredible stories and discover his kit on display at the Olympic Museum for the first time. Sky Brown who donated her skateboard shares her emotion in winning a medal at Tokyo 2020. Jeannette discovers the magic eye camera from London 1948 while Rob finds Michael Jordan’s iconic shoes from Barcelona 1992 which leads him to an unexpected “other dream team” story linking the Olympic and the Grateful Dead.

programme.title: The Vault: Greg Louganis, Hollywood, Beach Volleyball, Mascots
programme.desc: As we uncover Los Angeles 1984 Olympics memorabilia, we get to travel to the home of diving legend Greg Louganis to discover his emotional Olympic journey. The Summer Games are back in L.A. in 2028 but Hollywood made the Games a star-studded show from as early as Los Angeles 1932, from celebrity appearances to Olympians becoming movie stars. In The Vault, Jeannette finds a very special beach volleyball from Paris 2024 and Rob surprises her as they discover The Vault’s incredible mascots collection.

programme.title: Personal Best: Paris 2024
programme.desc: Relive the Paris 2024 Olympic Games through the journeys of eight remarkable athletes who pushed past limits, defied expectations, and inspired the world. Featuring Noah Lyles, Faith Kipyegon, Jack Robinson, Huang Yaqiong and Zheng Siwei, Leon Marchand, Olga Kharlan and Cindy Ngamba.

programme.title: Lauryn Williams’ Suits Prove She is Mastering More Than One Sport | The Vault
programme.desc: How does an Olympic sprinter become a bobsleigh champion? Lauryn Williams stunned the world by winning medals at both the Summer and Winter Olympic Games. Through one of her rare kits, we discover her incredible switch from track to ice and her personal Olympic journey.

programme.title: This Beach Volleyball Sparked a Revolution at the Paris Olympics | The Vault
programme.desc: Step inside "The Vault" with Jeanette as she is shown a special piece of Olympic history by curator Isabel: a signed beach volleyball from Paris 2024. This isn't just any ball; it tells the incredible story of Swedish Olympic champions Jonatan Hellvig and David Åhman. The creators of the game-changing "Swedish Jump" technique which has not only earned them a gold medal but also forever changed their sport.

programme.title: Matthias Steiner discovers his weightlifting kit on public display | The Vault
programme.desc: Jeanette and Rob welcome Olympic weightlifting champion Matthias Steiner in The Vault. The gold medallist from Beijing 2008 shares his personal story, from his early start in native Austria to the devastating loss of his wife, Susann. Find out how a promise made to his late spouse fuelled his incredible quest for gold at the Beijing 2008 Olympics, culminating in one of the most emotional moments in Olympic history.

programme.title: The ‘Magic Eye Camera’ and the Evolution of Olympic Timekeeping | The Vault
programme.desc: Ever wonder how they decide a winner when races are "too close to call"? We dive into the fascinating evolution of Olympic timekeeping, from the early days when judges literally had their noses on the line, to groundbreaking photo-finish technology adapted from horse racing with the introduction of the ‘magic eye camera’ at London 1948. Discover today’s incredible precision that separates gold from silver by milliseconds - such as between Noah Lyles and Kishane Thompson in the dramatic photo finish at Paris 2024.

programme.title: Another Dream Team Exists in the Olympic History | The Vault
programme.desc: Flashback to the Summer of 92. At the Barcelona games, with global superstars like Michael Jordan, Magic Johnson, Larry Bird and Charles Barkley, the US Dream Team causing a sensation at the 1992 Olympics. Jordan’s iconic shoe from that time is now one of the treasures of the Olympics. But soon the Lithuanian team, having just gained independence from the USSR, create another sensation. Money was short for the team, and they ended up being sponsored by Grammy Aaward winners and Rock & Roll Hall of Famers, the Grateful Dead. With the help of their own designer, they created the now- famous tie-dyed skeleton t-shirt, which soon became an icon of Lithuanian basketball, rising up through the ashes.

programme.title: Julien Alfred’s outfit is a symbol of national pride | The Vault
programme.desc: Jeannette and Rob bump into a collection of objects from Paris 2024. They discover the kit of Julien Alfred, the sprinting sensation who surprised everyone by winning the 100M final and bringing home the first ever gold medal for Saint-Lucia. Her outfit is the national flag featuring the blue of the sea, the yellow of the sun and the black for the volcanic mountains. We meet Julien on the island. She has overcome many personal challenges, including her father's passing, to achieve global superstardom. Her 100m gold and 200m silver medals at the Olympics have brought immense pride to her island nation, and her iconic kit now in the Museum stands as a symbol of her historical success.

programme.title: Before There Were Starting Blocks: a History of Olympic Sprint | The Vault
programme.desc: Join Jeanette to explore the evolution of the Olympic sprint. From digging into dirt in Athens 1896 to bold personal techniques before the introduction of wooden blocks and the revolutionary Tartan track.

programme.title: Jan Železný’s Record-Breaking Javelin: the Story of a Sport’s Evolution | The Vault
programme.desc: Olympian Jeanette examines three historic javelins. From wood to carbon fiber, she discovers not just the evolution of technology, but also the personal stories behind them. One of these artifacts belonged to Jan Železný, considered the greatest javelin thrower of all time. This type of javelin, with its precision-engineered design, helped him set a world record, a testament to both human potential and innovation in sport.

programme.title: Jeanette and Rob find Greg Louganis’s legendary trunks | The Vault
programme.desc: Rob and Jeanette discover swimming trunks which connect them to the inspiring story of Greg Louganis, considered by many as the greatest diver of all time. With the help of curator Patricia, they uncover other objects from Los Angeles 1984 and discover a story of athletic triumph, personal struggles, and resilience. We hear from Greg himself who welcomes us into his home in L.A. and describes his emotional Olympic journey. An HIV diagnosis right before the Seoul 1988 Olympic Games could have ended his career, but instead, Greg chose to persevere. Despite a dramatic first dive, where Greg hits the board with his head, he kept going and made history by winning two consecutive gold medals in Los Angeles 1984 and Seoul 1988.

programme.title: Best Olympic Rivals’ Iconic Items from Zatopek and Mimoun | The Vault
programme.desc: Olympian Jeanette Kwayke explores one of the most iconic rivalries in Olympic history. Red track shoes, Emil Zátopek, the Czech locomotive, blue vest, Alain Mimoun’s, the war hero and Zatopek’s shadow until Melbourne 1956. Both items reveal an incredible rivalry and friendship that lasted for more than three Olympiads.

programme.title: The Evolution of Swimwear Through Olympic History | The Vault
programme.desc: From the first wool trunks to the cutting-edge technologies of Paris 2024—passing through the controversial suits banned in the 2000s—Rob explores a collection of swimwear that reveals the evolution of swimming technology. Among them is Léon Marchand’s suit, a symbol of one of the greatest Olympic performances in swimming history.

programme.title: Helen Glover: The Paris rowing kit behind her incredible comeback | The Vault
programme.desc: Helen Glover donates her Paris Olympics official gear to the Museum and reveals an amazing story from unexpected beginnings to Olympic glory. The two-time Olympic gold medallist did not like rowing for years before triumphing in the sport. She recalls her success in London and Rio, her doubt after Tokyo and an incredible come back in Paris 2024.

programme.title: Sky Brown’s Helmet is a Treasure of the Olympics | The Vault
programme.desc: Skateboarding is a recent addition to the Olympic program. It was first included in the 2014 Youth Games in Nanjing and debuted at the Tokyo Olympics in 2020. The Vault already holds amazing objects from the sport: Momiji Nishiya’s board - the Japanese won gold at the first women’s street competition at the age of just 13 - and Sky Brown’s helmet. Sky won Bronze in Tokyo. She was also 13 at the time and became Britain’s youngest ever medallist. Her helmet has a special inscription on the back of it.

programme.title: This Coxless Paris 1924 Boat Holds a Secret | The Vault
programme.desc: Rob discovers an incredibly well-preserved gold medal winner two-man rowing scull from Paris 1924. This 10m boat now perfectly restored, belonged to a Dutch team. But their story does not start there, as in the 1900 Olympics they also won gold with the help of “the mysterious French boy,” who could we be the youngest gold medallist ever in the history of the Games.

programme.title: Rebeca Andrade’s yellow sparkly leotard is a symbol of resilience | The Vault
programme.desc: A shiny yellow leotard catches Rob and Jeanette’s attention in The Vault. It’s Rebeca Andrade’s suit from Paris 2024. It tells her story, one of courage, sacrifice, and resilience. We meet Rebeca at training in Rio. At just 10 years old, she left her family in the favelas to train professionally in Curitiba. After debuting at Rio 2016, she won silver and gold at Tokyo 2020, after recovering from her second ACL tear. But her greatest challenge came in Paris 2024, where she claimed gold in the floor event, surpassing the undefeated Simone Biles.

programme.title: Phil: breaking barriers to represent his community | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Canadian Breaker Phil ‘Wizard’ Kim, who comes from a traditional Korean family, takes to the streets of Vancouver, where he remembers how he fell in love with breaking and recounts his relentless journey to do what he loves the most : to dance.

programme.title: Ale: the Mexican diver trying to keep it all in synch | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Alejandra Orozco, two-time Olympic medallist in diving for Mexico, makes her fourth return to the Olympics at Paris 2024. More in sync than ever with her diving partner, Gabriela Agundez, and her family, she takes us back to where it all began: the family farm in the outskirt of Guadaljara. With the support of a loving family, hard work and dedication, she is hoping to reach the pinnacle of her career with Gold this Summer surrounded by her loved ones.

programme.title: Michael: No rest on the road to Olympic gold | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Take a look inside Michael Norman’s rigid routine as he prepares to redeem himself with an Olympic gold in the 400m distance at Paris 2024 this summer. While he is visiting his first track and field community, with family and fiancee all behind him, the American sprinter is dedicated to excellence.

programme.title: Who will join B-boy Victor for Team USA | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: Victor has secured a spot on Team USA. Who else will make it to Paris 2024? Jeffro is training with b-girl Logistix in Colorado Springs for a pre-Olympic festival in Japan. Each of our world class breakers gears up for the Olympic Qualifier Series and then the ultimate challenge: Olympic Games Paris 2024.

programme.title: Nicka takes it to the next level | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: As b-girl Nicka continues her intense preparation for the Games, Anti is about to take on a new opponent at the WDSF Breaking for Gold Series in Hong Kong: Japanese b-girl Ayane, whose brother b-boy Shigekix has already confirmed his spot on Team Japan. The energy in Hong Kong is intense as Ayane tries to make a final push to reach the Olympic Qualifiying Series.

programme.title: Ayane and Shigekix, a breaking family | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: Meet London-based b-girl Stefani who dances for Ukraine. Even though Ukraine’s breaking team is scattered across the globe, it doesn't dampen her spirit — she's all about having fun. Stefani faces b-girl Ayane at Hong Kong. Back in Japan, brother and sister breaking duo Shigekix and Ayane started breaking together. Along the last two years of competition, Shigekix is emerging as a favourite for a medal.

programme.title: B-Boys and B-Girls Take The Spotlight | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: As breaking prepares to make its Olympics debut in Paris 2024, we go inside the lives and regimens of the top breakers in the world leading up to the games. We meet b-boy Victor and b-girl Nicka who have secured Olympic spots, along with Olympic hopeful b-girl Anti still battling her way to the top. They all meet up in Los Angeles for one of the top event of the scene.

programme.title: Viktoriia: Ukraine’s Gymnastics Hope
programme.desc: As the bombs dropped in her hometown of Kyiv and her father left home to fight in the war, Ukrainian rhythmic gymnast Viktoriia Onopriienko battled daily to make her dream – competing in Paris 2024 – come true. This documentary showcases her grit, resilience and determination in her inspiring journey to compete at the Olympic Games. Discover the indomitable spirit of this young athlete as she prepares to represent Ukraine on the world stage.

programme.title: Dushyant’s Time to Shine | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: Dushyant reconnects with his roots in the family’s native village, spending time with Mahavir and his mother Daya Kaur. Babita pays a surprise visit to Mahavir’s training academy, supervising Dushyant and other students.

programme.title: Siblings Bonding | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: Dushyant's first international trip takes him to Singapore to surprise Ritu, showcasing their sibling bond as they explore the city together and conquer their fear of heights with a bungee jump.

programme.title: From One Challenge to Another | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: Sangeeta undergoes physiotherapy and trains at the sports academy, while Geeta discusses her comeback in wrestling. Dushyant works hard to improve his fitness, and Babita reflects on her decision to switch careers due to injury.

programme.title: Fun, Frolic and Fashion | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: Witness Babita’s life as a wife and mother in a joint family while managing her career. She surprises everyone by designing clothes for her siblings, leading to a photo-shoot to launch her brand. Mahavir and Daya Kaur reminisce as they browse through old medals.

programme.title: The End is Always the Beginning | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: The family gathers at Geeta’s house for a traditional Raksha Bandhan celebration. Following the festivities, the siblings announce their aspirations: Geeta vows a comeback, and Sangeeta and Dushyant declare their pursuit of Olympic glory to fulfil their father’s dream.

programme.title: Living Up to Expectations | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: We delve into Geeta's life at the police academy, Babita's role in politics, and Ritu's MMA training in Singapore. Meanwhile, Dushyant and Sangeeta add a touch of fun with Instagram reels.

programme.title: Life and Love | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: Explore Bajrang and Sangeeta’s love story, rooted in mutual support and a shared passion for wrestling. Gain insights into how each spouse supports their partner's dreams. Meanwhile, Dushyant and Ritu share their perspectives on relationships.

programme.title: Meet the Phogats | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: Mahavir convenes a family lunch to discuss the futures of Dushyant and Sangeeta, urging them to train for the upcoming Paris 2024 Olympics. However, Geeta, who also aspires for a comeback in professional wrestling, feels neglected by Mahavir's focus.

programme.title: Nikoloz: The judo World Champion from two nations | The Starting Line
programme.desc: When Nikoloz Sherazadishvili’s family moved him from Georgia to Spain at a young age, his father instilled a love of judo in him. He quickly felt at home at the local club of Brunete, in the outskirt of Madrid, where everything started with his first coach Quino Ruiz. As he gears up for his second Olympics, surrounded by his family and friends, he’s competing on the mat for Spain but also holding Georgia and the memory of his father close to his heart.

programme.title: Carlota: Proving herself and her sport to the world | The Starting Line
programme.desc: A young female breaker for France, Carlota Dudek is training to qualify for the Olympics to showcase her unique style to the world, inherited from her mother Cuban origin. We travel with her from Paris to her hometown in the heart of Provence where her life-long dance journey began.

programme.title: Ferdinand: The Beast from the East returns to his roots | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Known as the ‘Fastest Man in Africa’ for his prowess in the 100m, Ferdinand Omanyala is setting his sights on becoming the fastest man in the world at Paris 2024. We follow him as he travels back to his hometown of Kitale in Kenya to get the blessings he needs from his peers and uncover the remarkable story of his origins.

programme.title: Teahupo'o Surf Camp | Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: Experience the thrills and spills as seven surfers join an ISA surf camp at Teahupo'o, Tahiti's famed surf spot and the surfing venue for the Olympic Games Paris 2024. Determined to conquer the Olympic wave, they face their fears, push the boundaries and challenge the raw power of nature.

programme.title: The graceful journey of Olympic champion, Jessica von Bredow-Werndl | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Jessica’s dream became reality at Tokyo 2020 with two Olympic Gold medals in dressage in the individual and team event. But her incredible bond with her horse, Dalera, is forged by hard work and an implacable discipline at Aubenhausen world-class riding centre. With her title back on the line at Paris 2024, she opens the doors of her family estate and reflects, with her family and her team, on an emotional journey full of joy and determination.

programme.title: Kauli Vaast’s Tahitian roots make him a favourite for Gold | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Witness Kauli Vaast's journey from his childhood Tahitian shores to the world stage. Surrounded by his family and long time friend and mentor Jeremy Flores, he refines his craft at Teahupo'o impressive pipe where he will compete on hometurf for an Olympic Gold medal in surfing. Driven by passion and cheered on by those who believe in his dream, he balances the thrill of competition with the warmth of a unique community.

programme.title: Kieran Reilly’s ride to the world stage | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Join Kieran Reilly on his quest for Olympic glory as he reflects on his journey from Gateshead to becoming BMX world champion. He navigates the challenges of training, family support, and personal growth, while striving to make his hometown proud. Follow his inspirational story as he prepares to represent his community at the next Olympic Games in Paris 2024.
